description: This course is devoted to studying Latin American and Spanish expressive culture covering both popular culture and folklore. The areas of study include Mexico, the Caribbean, Central America, the Rio de la Plata Region, Brazil, the Andean Region, Latinos/as in the US, and Spain. The primary goal of this course isto expose students to the heterogeneity of expressive cultures in these areas as a way to open up deeper insights on the colonization of the Americas, analyzing the Indian, African, and Spanish components. Aside from academic works, other materials such as popular novels, comics, and other media (film and television) are incorporated. The course will be conducted in Spanish and will have brief practical exercises, a final project, a mid-term exam, and weekly posts in an interactive web-page.
name: SPAIN AT WAR, 1936-1939
